title: The One With the Princess Leia Fantasy

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm tellin' ya that girl totally winked at me.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Did not, she did not wink at you...(sees that their sacred couch is occupied by strangers).

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Huh. (They all leave, dejected)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel and Monica's, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I have to say Tupolo Honey by Van Morrison.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nooo Way! The most romantic song ever is The Way We Were .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: See, I-I think that one that Elton John wrote for, um, that guy on Who's The Boss .

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What song was that, Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) Hold me close, young Tony Dan-za .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi Monica!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey Mon!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey Mon!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God, has she slept at all?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nope.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, it's been three nights in a row.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, she finally stopped crying yesterday, but then she found one of Richard's cigar butts out on the terrace, so.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay that explains it. I got a call at two in the morning, but all I could hear was, like, this high squeaky sound, so I thought okay its like a mouse or a opossum. But then I realized where would a mouse or a opossum get the money to make the phone call.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is coming in from the bedroom]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Morning.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Morning, hey, you made pancakes?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, like there's any way I could ever do that.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (entering and singing) Monica and Rachel had syrup, now I can get my man to cheer up. (laughs hysterically) Good morning Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sarcastically) Good morning.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, you know what, here's a thought. Why don't you stay home from work today and just hang out with me.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, I wish. Look, honey, you have that report to finish, and I gotta go see my lawyer.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can not believe that I am going out with someone that is getting divorced. I'm such a grown up.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (laughs) I-I-I gotta go, I gotta go. Okay, not without a kiss.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, maybe I won't kiss you, and then you'll have to stay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (under his breath) Kiss her! Kiss her!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I'll see you later, sweetie. Bye Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: B-bye Janice. So when ya' dumpin' her.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nope, not this time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on, quite yankin' me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm not yanking you.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: This is Janice.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know. She makes me happy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay. All right. You look me in the eye and tell me, without blinking, that you're not breaking up with her. No blinking.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (looks him in the eye) I'm not breaking up with her! (they stare at each other for a while, then Joey blows in his face)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel and Monica's, Monica is entering from the bathroom.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: God, look what I found in the drain.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's some of Richard's hair! (holds it close to Ross) What do I do with this?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Getting it away from me would be job one.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's weird, but you know what I don't wanna throw this away. I mean this is like all I have left of him, gross, drain hair. Ooh! (drops it in Ross's cereal)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh. Oh. It looks like, like a tiny little person drowning in your cereal. (Ross gives her this look, like 'Yeah, doesn't it', and gets up to dump it down the drain.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: God, what is wrong with me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You need to get some sleep.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I need to get some Richard.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, you broke up with him for a reason.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know, I know. I'm just so tired of-of missing him. I'm tired of wondering why hasn't he called. Why hasn't he called!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Maybe, because you told him not to.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you the memory woman?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) Their not breaking up. Chandler and Janice. Their not breaking up. He didn't blink or anything.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, you know I'm not surprised. I mean have you seen them together, they're really cute.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Cute! This is Janice! You remember Janice?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, Joey, I remember, she's annoying, but you know what she's-she's his girlfriend now. I mean what can we do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: There you go! That's the spirit I'm looking for! What can we do? Huh? All right who's first? Huh? Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well I'm thinking that Chandler's our friend and Janice makes him happy, so I say we just all be adult about it and accept her.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, we'll call that Plan B. All right?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Ross's bedroom, Ross is working and Rachel is reading a book in bed]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (she leans over and kisses him on the cheek) Honey, I was wondering....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hmm?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Do you still have that, um, Navy uniform?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nooo, I had to return it to the costume place.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hmm.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I think I have an old band uniform from high school.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You remember not having sex in high school, right?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well honey, what about you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean do you have any fun, you know, fantasy type things?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on you gotta have one!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nope.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, you know what...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ...if you tell me, I might do it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, umm. Did you ever see, um, Return Of The Jedi ?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Do you remember the scene with, um, Jabba the Hut? Well Jabba had as, as his prisoner, um, Princess Leia.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oooh!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Princess Leia, was wearing this, um, gold bikini thing. It was pretty cool.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are there]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, oh, Princess Leia and the gold bikini, every guy our age loved that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, um. It's huge. Yeah, that's the moment, when-when, you know she stopped being a princess, and became, like, a woman, you know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Did you ever do the-the Leia thing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, um-mm. Oh!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really! That-that great huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No it's just that I got this new pager and I have it on vibrate. See ya!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering with Monica in tow) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi you guys!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look who I found standing outside of the Szechwan Dragon staring at a parking meter.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mon. Hi!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why aren't you at work?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, they-they sent me home.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Because I don't work at the Szechwan Dragon.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You really, really need to get some sleep, honey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know I do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Guess what?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: They published my paper.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, really, let me see, let me see.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Rach, look! (she holds two buns up to her ears to make her hair look like the Princess Leia 'do.) Oh, hi! Where is my strong Ross Skywalker to come rescue me. (Ross stands up horrified) There he is.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching Wheel of Fortune, the puzzle is showing
_oun_ Rush_ore.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wheel!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Of!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Fortune! This guy is so stupid. (yelling) It's Count Rushmore!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, you should really go on this show. All right, listen, I got three tickets to the Rangers tonight. What'd ya' say?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I say, 'I am there!' Cool! Aw, is Ross going to?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Jan-ice. 'Cause I, just, I feel bad for Ross, you know, we-we always go together, we're like the three hocke-teers.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, I may be way out on a limb here, but do you, do you, have a problem with Janice?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, Yeeees. God, how do I say this. (walks into the kitchen, Chandler follows closely, he turns around and gets startled). Oh, hi, you know that girl from the Greek restaurant with the hair (holds his hands up to signify she has big hair)?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh, that girl that I hate, eww, drives me crazy, eww, eww, oh!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, I don't hate Janice, she's-she's just a lot to take, you know.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, there you go.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, hey. Come on man, don't look at me like that, she used to drive you nuts before too, remember?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I'm crazy about her now. I think this could be the real thing. Capital 'R'! Capital 'T'! (Joey stares at him) Don't worry, those are the right letters.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, what do you want me to say?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I want you to say that you like her!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I can't. It's like this chemical thing, you know. Every time she starts laughing, I just wanna (grimaces and tenses up) pull my arm off just so that I can have something to throw at her.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks for trying. (grabs the ticket and starts to leave) Oh, and by the way there is no Count Rushmore!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, then-then who's the guy that painted the faces on the mountain? (Chandler gives him a look like 'You stupid idiot!')

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Ross are entering]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How could you have told her?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, I didn't think it would that big of a deal.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, she didn't think it would be that big of deal.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, who are you talking to when you do that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, that was supposed to be like a private, personal thing between us.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, Ross, Phoebe is my girlfriend, okay, we tell each other everything. You know, I mean, come on, guys do the same thing, I mean, what about all that locker room stuff.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's different, okay. That's like, uh 'Who dated a stripper?' or 'Who did it on the back of the Staton Island Ferry?'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Were both of those Joey?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. Look, you don't, you don't talk about like, you know, your girlfriend and the intimate stuff you, you do with her.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Not even with your best friend.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Noo!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That is so sad. Your missing out on so much, Ross. I mean, the bonding and the sharing, you know. And-and knowing that someone else is going through the same thing you are.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hmph. So what you, you tell each other everything?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pretty much.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Did you talk about the night of five times? Do you tell people about the night of five times?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, honey, yeah that was with Carol.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know, but it's still worth mentioning, I think.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica's bedroom, Phoebe is trying to relax her.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ( in a soothing voice) Relax every muscle in your body. Listen to the plinky-plunky music. Okay, now close you eyes, and think of a happy place. Okay, tell me your happy place.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Richard's living room, drinking wine.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right. No, no, no, not a Richard thing, just put down the glass. And get out!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but that's my happy place.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, okay, fine, use my happy place. Okay, I'm just gonna, I have to ask that you don't move anything.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, I'll try not to.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, all right, so, your in a meadow, millions of stars in the sky....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you think breaking up with him was a huge mistake?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, there are no questions in the happy place. Okay, just, the warm breeze, and the moonlight flowing through the trees....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'll bet he's totally over me, I'll bet he's fine.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, betting and wagering of any kind, are, I'm sure, not permitted in the happy place. Okay. Just-just, you know, the-the lovely waterfalls, and the, the trickling fountains. And the-the calming sounds of the babbling brook....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, this isn't working. I'm still awake and now I have to pee.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: So, I hear, you hate me!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I, ah, I never said hate, I was very careful about that.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: A little birdie told me something about you wanting to rip your arm off and throw it at me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And you got a 'hate' from that?! Your taking a big leap there...

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: All right, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, we've got to do something about our little situation here Joey. So,

dialogue.speaker: THIS IS MY IDEA
dialogue.text: you and me spending some quality time together.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But what does that gonna do...

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: For Chandler!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay. I'm in.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Okay. All right. T

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Does it have to be a whole day?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Yes, because that's how long it takes to love me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know, I sleep in the next room.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel and Monica are entering]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (crying) So, I went down to the post office, and it turns out it was those videos that I ordered for Richard about the Civil War. He loved the Civil War.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica, do you want us to take you home?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, huh. (to Ross) Or maybe to a galaxy far, far away. (Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe leave)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Women tell each other everything. Did you know that?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Umm, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No Chandler, everything! Like stuff you like, stuff she likes, technique, stamina, girth....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Girth? Why, why, why, wh-why, why, why, why would they do this?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rachel says sharing's great and supposedly, you know, we outta be doing it. Do you wanna?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We're not gonna talk about girth are we?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nooo!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah! All right! You go first.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, I'll go first.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, uh, the other night Rachel and I are in bed talking about fantasies, and I happened to describe a particular Star Wars thing....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Princess Leia in the gold bikini.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes! Wow, well, that-that was easy. Okay, you-you go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, you know, you know when your in bed, with a woman.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hmph.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And, ah, you know, your fooling around with her. And you get all these like, mental images in your brain, you know, like Elle MacPherson, or that girl at the Xerox place....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: With the belly-button ring? Oh, muhawa!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know, And then all of the sudden your Mom pops into your head. And your like 'Mom, get outta here!' You know, but of course, like, after that you can't possibly think of anything else, and you can't, you know, stop what your doing. So it's kinda like, you're, you know. You know...(Ross just stares at him). You don't know!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Your Mom, your telling me, your telling me, about your Mom, what is the matter with you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You said...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I said ' share ' not ' scare '. Go sit over there! (Chandler goes over and sits at a table and puts his head down).

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Janice are returning from their DAY OF FUN!]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: We're baack!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you guys doing together?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Joey and Janice's DAY OF FUN !!! (laughs)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Really.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah. We went to a Mets game, we got Chinese food, and you know, I love this woman. You have got competition buddy.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I just came by to give you a kiss, I have to go pick up the baby, so. I'll see you later sweetheart, you too Chandler. (laughs)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You still can't stand her can you?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm sorry man, I tired, I really did.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, you know, I appreciate you giving it a shot.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But, hey, look, you know the good thing is, is that we spent the whole day together and I survived, and what's even more amazing, so did she. It was bat day at Shea Stadium.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I guess that's something.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No man, that's huge! Now, I know I can stand to be around her, which means I get to hang out with you, which is kinda the whole point, anyway.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, hey, Chandler, we, ah, we stopped by the coffee shop and ran into Ross.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh God!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, if it makes you feel any better, I do it too.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, I always picture your Mom when I'm having sex.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel and Monica's, Monica is watching the Civil War videos]

dialogue.speaker: VIDEO
dialogue.text: April Twelve, Eighteen hundred, Sixty-One (Monica lights Richard's cigar butt), 4:30 A.M. on Tuesday, the United States garrison at Fort Sumter was fired upon (knock on door) it is now under bombardment by....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi, Dad, what are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Well, it's your mother's bridge night so I thought that I would come into the city for a little Monicuddle. (hugs her) Since when did you start smoking cigars?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't, I just, I just like the smell of them. So, uh, what are you really doing here Dad?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Well, I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What makes you think that I might not be okay?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: I saw Richard.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: So, how are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm fine, just a little tired, I'm okay. How's Richard doing?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: You don't wanna know.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, I really, really do.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Well, he's doing terrible!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really!

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Worse than when he broke up with Barbara.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're not just saying that are you?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: No, the man is a mess.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Was he crying?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, do you think he was waiting 'til after you left, so he could cry?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Maybe.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think so.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Honey, relationships are hard. Like with your Mom and me. You know after we graduated college we broke up for a while. It seems her Father, your Grandfather, wanted her to travel around Europe, like he did. Of course, he got to do it on Uncle Sam's nickel, because he was also strafing German troop trains at the time. However, (turns around and sees that Monica is sleeping and puts a blanket around her, kisses her, picks up the cigar, and starts watching the video)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross's bedroom, Ross is humming the Star Wars theme. Rachel enters, with her
hair done up like Princess Leia's, and wearing a belly dancer's outfit, to simulate the
gold bikini thing.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, here we go. I'm Jabba's prisoner, and you have a really weird look on your face. What? Honey, what is it? Did I get it wrong? Did I get the hair wrong? What? Did you just picture it differently? What? What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no it's, um, it's not you, um, it's um, it's (turns and sees his Mom standing where Rachel is)

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Well what is it? Come on sweetie, your like, freaking me out here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I hate Chandler, the bastard ruined my life. (Rachel starts looking around and down, with a 'What the hell is going on?' look on her face.)
